title.narrative: Strengthening Agriculture TVET Teacher Training in Kenya and the Netherland

participating-org.narrative: Technical Vocational Education and Training Authority

mailing-address.narrative: P.O. Box 29777, 2502 LT The Hague, The Netherlands

title.narrative: Project photo
Narrative report

description.narrative: Reporting is an important management tool which is used to inform relevant government officials and other stakeholders about the results being achieved by individual projects and the programme as a whole. For project partners, it is compulsory to use the prescribed Orange Knowledge annual report format in order to report on project achievements. The annual report also provides valuable data on the financial situation of the project. Based on an analysis of the project performance in relation to the project output(s) and expected outcome(s), a revision of the project work plan may be suggested by the project partners. The consequences of a possible revision on the project work plan and budget must be made clear in the annual report. Nuffic monitors outputs and outcomes and not activities . Therefore, the main focus of the annual report must be on the achievement of the project’s output(s) and planned outcome(s). The information provided in the annual reports of the projects is used by Nuffic to monitor the progress of the project and to inform the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and other stakeholders about the output(s) and outcome(s) being achieved by individual projects and the Orange Knowledge programme as a whole. Please note that if project progress is in accordance with the original planning, reporting requirements are minimal. Only in case of deviations from the planning, more elaboration is demanded. In the grant award letter, the dates for submission of the annual reports are mentioned. In case of a three-year project, between 5-7 reports are obligatory. The first report (0) is a very short report which focuses on specific conditions and/or recommendations in the grant. There is no need to report on progress in achieving outputs and outcomes, which is done in the first annual report. As annex to the report 0, the consortium agreements between the partners should be submitted. The final report must reflect on the entire project period.

title.narrative: 14. Final report TMT+/TMT

description.narrative:
Final conclusions TMT+/TMT (in case of final report) Reflect on how the training has contributed to addressing the capacity needs as described by the requesting organisation in the proposal form. How effective and efficient has the TMT+ been in reaching the desired objectives? Please formulate lessons learned and recommendations for the post-project period.
+
In your email submitting the final report, the partners will enclose: - an inventory of equipment purchased - a document signed by the (Lead partner) Dutch consortium/provider and Lead partner consortium country A or requesting organisation on the transfer of ownership - a list with the names and email addresses of staff members who participated in staff training for their registration in the Holland Alumni Network database

title.narrative: A. TVET/HE organisations perform better their core tasks, firmly embedded in their environment
A.E.5. Number of curricula for degree, non-degree and short courses revised/newly developed

description.narrative: Degree: bachelor's, master's and doctorate Non degree: Certificate and diploma

comment.narrative: 24-02-2021: Is in process in two ways: A DACUM process is being done that will deliver the occupational profiles (OP), standards (OS) and curricula as required by CDACC/TVETA in the Kenyan system. The project developed OP/OS for TVET instructor and OP/OS for TVET Manager-developer. CDACC is actively involved. Another process being enhanced, is the design of professional task, assessment criteria, learning outcomes and teaching-learning materials. Parallel the traineeship programme is being revised to be improved (year 2). As a result, 4 curricula are in process of being revised and approved. For the development of curricula, 21 professional tasks have been selected. Professional tasks for technical-instructor, trainer, developer and manager. The selected professional tasks are used for revision of four curricula. Two at KTTC: for technical-instructor and for trainer both one year programmes. At Egerton University a two programme’s and a 4 years programme for trainers.

title.narrative: A.O.1. Improved gender equality and gender awareness in the knowledge institution

description.narrative: please enclose stories of change or examples of best practices

actual.value: The first gender and inclusiveness assessment workshops have been held and a work plan has been prepared. Each partner institution has delegated its Gender Focal Person (GFP). This project-team will prepare a module on Gender and Inclusiveness and all teachers will be trained to learn about gender and inclusiveness issues in teaching and learning processes. The projects aim at having a specific Gender & Inclusiveness module as part of the improved curriculum. All project partners will be strengthened to form part of relevant platforms (e.g. UNEVOC, Gender Commission) to exchange experiences and best practices.

title.narrative: A.O.10. Diversity in management and teaching staff (i.e. balance in junior/senior staff, women/men, minorities)

description.narrative: please enclose stories of change or examples of best practices

actual.value: The project did not take specific actions yet in activities enhanced so far. The participation of male and female is distributed equally. As part of the G & I staff training a module on gender & inclusiveness learning and teaching processes will be prepared. In this module, elements of diversity in management and teaching staff, will be included.

title.narrative: A.O.3. Number of organisations revised/developed institutional mechanism for quality assurance

comment.narrative: 24-02-2021: All TVET institutions are under TVETA regulations which means they have appointed a QA officer and have gone through or will go through the TVETA intake process to be accredited. Supported by the NICHE-KEN283 project a Quality Assurance Framework for the TVET has been developed together with an online TVET MIS. An advanced draft of the Trainer Qualification Framework has been discussed in the kick-off workshop of our OKP project and suggestions for improvement have been in taken into account. The project will have a detailed look at QA mechanisms for traineeship-coaching, partnerships, entrepreneurship regarding ATVET teacher training, once piloting will have concluded. In this framework it is important to mention that Egerton University curriculum for ATVET teacher training at Bachelor level is quality assured by the Ministry of Higher Education, Science & Technology.

title.narrative: A.O.9. Number of organisations with improved policies or procedures to encourage access to education of minorities

comment.narrative: 24-02-2021: In Kenya all policies and procedures focus on access to education for minorities, although no specific funding has been allocated in institutional budgets and no special plans have been developed yet.

title.narrative: A.E.4. Number of graduates delivered

comment.narrative: 24-02-2021: No graduates have been delivered yet. Because of Covid it is not sure if the project manages to deliver graduates within the time frame of the project as the development process had quite some delay. The lack of clarity on the date of re-opening of the educational institutes continues at the moment of preparation of this report.
any graduates at Masters and PhD level?

title.narrative: A.E.6. Number of students enrolled in revised/newly developed study programmes

comment.narrative: 24-02-2021: No students have enrolled yet. Because of Covid it is not clear to what extent the project manages to enrol them within the time frame of the project as the development process had quite some delay and a lack of clarity on the date op re-opening of the educational institutes and the possibility to have traineeship done in TVET institutes and industry in year 2 of the project.

title.narrative: A.R.2. Number of relevant publications (level, gender, inclusion)

comment.narrative: 2 Dacum charts on certificate and diploma and 2 quality standards

24-02-2021: Supported by the OKP project, 2 DACUM based occupational profiles and standards for TVET instructor and TVET Manager-developer are being prepared and will be published in year 2. These will be based on the CDACC, KNQA and CBET requirements, having been validated by 3 TVET institutions and industry if situation regarding Covid-19 will allow this.
2 publications on QA traineeship

title.narrative: A.E.2. Increased participation of students from minorities

comment.narrative: 24-02-2021: The design process is taking into account the needs of minorities. The group of physically disabled persons has been defined as target group, with special focus on deaf persons together with a special needs TVET institution.

title.narrative: A.S.2. Number of MoUs or other types of collaboration agreements signed (education, private, public, surrounding community)

comment.narrative: 24-02-2021: The first workshops with very relevant partners from government and private sector have been held. No concrete agreements regarding traineeships and joint activities have been prepared yet in this first year. The project aims at having established or improved 18 MoU’s or other types of collaboration agreements signed by the end of year 2 of the project (May 2021). We wish that it will be possible to monitor the implementation of these agreements.

title.narrative: A.S.3. Number of students performing an internship or practical work

comment.narrative: 24-02-2021: The improvement of the existing traineeship and industrial attachment programmes is in process. A mobile phone app for ATVET teacher training coaching processes will be developed to make coaching more useful and effective as part of the learning and teaching process. The project aimed at having 268 students performing an (improved) internship but taking into account the limitations imposed by Covid-19 we will monitor if this really will be feasible within the time-span of the project.
30 ATVET trainers students perform a traineeship
30 ATVET trainers students perform a traineeship

title.narrative: A.O.6. Number of facilities established/strengthened

comment.narrative: 24-02-2021: The project aims at strengthening TVETA (teacher training, outreach, quality assurance ad accreditation), KTTC (ATVET teacher training), Egerton University (Faculty of Agronomy) and 3 TVET institutes (Latia, Bukura and DTI).
1 ICT based platform connecting internship providers with internship students
resource centres, laboratories, practical application unit etc.

title.narrative: A.O.7. % of women in management of faculty/department

comment.narrative: 24-02-2021: The project didn’t take specific actions, in activities enhanced so far by the project the participation of male and female is distributed equally. In specific G & I staff training planned in the project, a module on gender & inclusiveness learning and teaching processes will be prepared. Equal participation will be dealt with in this module.

title.narrative: A.O.8. % of women of teaching staff of faculty/department

comment.narrative: 24-02-2021: The project didn’t take specific actions, in activities enhanced so far by the project the participation of male and female is distributed equally. In specific G & I staff training planned in the project, a module on gender & inclusiveness learning and teaching processes will be prepared. Equal participation will be dealt with in this module.

title.narrative: A.E.7. Student satisfaction

comment.narrative: 24-02-2021: The project is working on curriculum improvement. No students or graduates have been in this curriculum so far. Due to Covid-19 measures the processes have had delays. Up to now, no students have been allowed to follow classes. It is not clear yet how and when re-opening will be possible.
anything to mention about student satisfaction on traineeships?

title.narrative: A.R.3. Number of relevant innovations

comment.narrative: 24-02-2021: The project is working on innovations in the teaching and learning approaches used so far in ATVET teacher training in Kenya. The new approach is based on the real professional task of an agricultural TVET trainer. Other innovation in process of development, consists of improvements in the traineeship programme in industry and TVET institutes. A mobile phone app for ATVET teacher training coaching processes will be developed to make coaching more useful and effective as part of the learning and teaching process.
3 mobile app innovations for blended learning established and 3 entrepreneurship tools

title.narrative: A.E.1. Number of (knowledge) institutions supported directly

comment.narrative: 24-02-2021: The project started the process of improving the curricula of Egerton University and KTTC. Professional tasks, assessment criteria and learning tasks have been developed. An inventory of traineeship programmes and experiences has been concluded. TVET institutes like Latia, Bukura and DTI participated actively in these processes. Each project partner revised critically their existing partnerships and is in process of connecting with new partners. TVETA is coordinating the project activities in a very effective way.

title.narrative: A.O.5. Number of organisations that have developed and implemented a system to regularly survey the satisfaction of students, short courses participants, graduates and/or employers

comment.narrative: 24-02-2021: This will be part of the process of curriculum improvement. In the QA system implemented under responsibility of TVETA, a graduate follow-up system is promoted to survey the satisfaction of students, ATVET teacher training short courses, graduates and employers. Important to consider that KTTC just recently started with a specific ATVET teacher training programme and doesn’t have graduates yet prepared by the actual curriculum. Before that KTTC offered only generic teacher training courses for graduates of all technical colleges and universities who wanted to become a TVET trainer.

title.narrative: A.O.11. Number of organisations with policies and procedures to ensure an environment which is gender sensitive

comment.narrative: 25-02-2021: All project partners have policies in place to ensure an gender sensitive environment. In the QA framework promoted by TVETA specific criteria have been developed and are also integrated the MIS. This project didn’t take specific actions yet. As part of the G & I staff training and a module on gender & inclusiveness learning and teaching processes, these elements will be dealt with. Very relevant materials tailored to the Kenyan TVET context are under development now.

title.narrative: A.O.12. Number of organisations with policies and procedures to ensure an environment which is conducive for minorities

comment.narrative: 25-02-2021: In Kenya all policies and procedures focus on conducive environment for minorities, although no specific funding or measures have been allocated in institutional budgets and plans. The project will focus on the group of youth with special needs and for that, will establish linkages with relevant specialised TVET institutes. In the recruitment and selection of new students, special attention will be paid to the enrolment of this group.

title.narrative: A.E.3. Number of staff that have gained qualitative and relevant knowledge and skills to develop and offer the revised/developed study programmes
